Class RestockDataManager

java.lang.Object
plasystem_functions.RestockDataManager
public class RestockDataManager extends Object
Manages restocking operations in the PlaSystem database, including creating, retrieving, and deleting restock events. Handles single and multiple product restocks, updates product quantities, and ensures database consistency through transactions and comprehensive error checking based on schema constraints.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private static final String
    DELETE_RESTOCK_QUERY
    SQL query to delete a restock event from the Restock table.
    private static final String
    INSERT_RESTOCK_ITEM_QUERY
    SQL query to insert a restock item into the RestockItems table.
    private static final String
    INSERT_RESTOCK_QUERY
    SQL query to insert a new restock event into the Restock table.
    private final ProductDataManager
    productDataManager
    Manager for product data operations, used to refresh product quantities after restocking.
    private final LinkedList<RestockData>
    restockList
    In-memory list of restock events, synchronized with the database.
    private static final String
    SELECT_RESTOCK_ITEMS_QUERY
    SQL query to select restock items for a specific restock event from the RestockItems table.
    private static final String
    SELECT_RESTOCK_QUERY
    SQL query to select all restock events from the Restock table.
    private static final String
    UPDATE_PRODUCT_QUANTITY_QUERY
    SQL query to update the quantity of a product in the Product table.

    RestockDataManager(ProductDataManager productDataManager)
    Constructs a RestockDataManager with a dependency on ProductDataManager and initializes the restock list by loading all restock events from the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • RestockDataManager

      public RestockDataManager(ProductDataManager productDataManager)
      Constructs a RestockDataManager with a dependency on ProductDataManager and initializes the restock list by loading all restock events from the database.
      Parameters:
      productDataManager - The manager for product data operations. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if productDataManager is null.

  • Method Details

    • getRestockList

      public List<RestockData> getRestockList()
      Retrieves the list of restock events.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable view of the list of RestockData objects.

    • loadRestocks

      private void loadRestocks()
      Loads all restock events and their associated items from the database into the in-memory restock list. Clears the existing list before loading to ensure synchronization with the database. Displays an error message if a database error occurs.

    • restockProduct

      public boolean restockProduct(ProductData product, int quantity)
      Performs a restock operation for a single product, creating a restock event, adding a restock item, and updating the product's quantity in a single transaction. Refreshes the product and restock lists upon success. Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs or database errors.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to restock. Must not be null and must have valid attributes.
      quantity - The quantity to add. Must be positive.
      Returns:
      true if the restock operation is successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if product is null.

    • restockMultipleProducts

      public boolean restockMultipleProducts(List<Map<String,Object>> items)
      Performs a restock operation for multiple products as a single restock event, creating one restock event, adding restock items, and updating product quantities in a single transaction. Refreshes the product and restock lists upon success. Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs or database errors.
      Parameters:
      items - A list of maps, each containing a ProductData object (key "product") and its restock quantity (key "quantity"). Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      true if the restock operation is successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if items is null.

    • deleteRestock

      public boolean deleteRestock(int restockId)
      Deletes a restock event and its associated items from the database using a transaction. Refreshes the restock list upon success. Displays an error message if the restock ID does not exist or a database error occurs.
      Parameters:
      restockId - The ID of the restock event to delete. Must exist in the database.
      Returns:
      true if the deletion is successful, false otherwise.

    • validateRestockInputs

      private boolean validateRestockInputs(ProductData product, int quantity)
      Validates inputs for a restock operation based on database schema constraints for the RestockItems table (e.g., non-null fields, non-negative price, positive quantity). Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to restock. Must not be null and must have valid attributes.
      quantity - The quantity to restock. Must be positive.
      Returns:
      true if the inputs are valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if product is null.

    • createRestockEvent

      private int createRestockEvent(Connection conn) throws SQLException
      Creates a new restock event in the Restock table with the current date and time. Validates date components to ensure they are non-empty.
      Parameters:
      conn - The database connection. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      The ID of the created restock event.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database error occurs or date components are invalid.
      NullPointerException - if conn is null.

    • insertRestockItem

      private void insertRestockItem(Connection conn, int restockId, ProductData product, int quantity) throws SQLException
      Inserts a restock item into the RestockItems table, recording the product details and restocked quantity for a specific restock event.
      Parameters:
      conn - The database connection. Must not be null.
      restockId - The ID of the restock event. Must exist in the Restock table.
      product - The product being restocked. Must not be null and must have valid attributes.
      quantity - The quantity restocked. Must be positive.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database error occurs or the insertion fails.
      NullPointerException - if conn or product is null.

    • updateProductQuantity

      private void updateProductQuantity(Connection conn, int productId, int quantity) throws SQLException
      Updates the quantity of a product in the Product table by adding the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      conn - The database connection. Must not be null.
      productId - The ID of the product. Must exist in the Product table.
      quantity - The quantity to add. Must be positive.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database error occurs or the product ID does not exist.
      NullPointerException - if conn is null.

    • handleSQLException

      private void handleSQLException(SQLException e)
      Handles SQL exceptions by displaying specific error messages based on the error type, such as constraint violations (NOT NULL, CHECK, FOREIGN KEY) or general database errors.
      Parameters:
      e - The SQLException to handle. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if e is null.
